template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a {business_type} that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a retail chain that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Design a workflow that triages customer issues, resolves simple ones automatically, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance metrics.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants me to generate a single-sentence prompt in plain English under 40 words. Let me break down what they need. They mentioned a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a retail chain. The key elements are triage, automatic resolution for simple issues, escalation for complex cases, and performance tracking.

I need to make sure all these components are included in one concise sentence. Triage should come first to categorize issues. Then mention automatic fixes for simple ones, followed by escalation for harder cases. Performance tracking is also crucial to wrap it up. 

Keeping it under 40 words means being precise. Avoid jargon and keep it flow naturally. Maybe start with "Design a workflow that..." to directly address the request. Combine the steps smoothly without listing them bullet-style. 

Check the word count: "Design a workflow that triages customer issues, resolves simple ones automatically, escalates complex cases, and tracks performance metrics." That’s 20 words. All key points are covered, and it’s straightforward. No need for extra details since the user only wanted the prompt text.
